title: Gunmen Attack Ulster Court
description: Gunmen raked the outside of a courthouse in Newry with automatic fire today, minutes after a judge and witnesses left the building, the police said. The attack by at least two men driving a car sent hundreds of shoppers and businessmen diving for cover.

title: RAPE SUSPECT KILLED IN SHOOTOUT
description: A 27-year-old man suspected of raping the 17-year-old companion of a rookie police officer last Sunday was killed in a shootout with policemen in his Upper Manhattan apartment house early yesterday morning, the police said.

title: GEORGIA DIVIDED OVER SPRAYING TO CURB MARIJUANA
description: The Federal Drug Enforcement Administration's use of paraquat sprayed from a helicopter to destroy 60 marijuana plants growing in northern Georgia has unleashed a torrent of criticism from elected officials and from residents of the area.

title: Q & A
description: Q. Several years ago I had new cedar siding installed on the outside of my house. This was finished with a clear wood preservative and now the entire surface of this cedar is now covered with mildew. I tried a commercial mildew remover on a small section and found that it removed the mildew, but it also removed the finish and bleached the wood lighter. I would like to keep the cedar looking as natural as possible, so can you tell what I can use to remove the mildew without removing the present finish and without bleaching the wood?

title: Canadiens Curbed
description: John Ziegler , the National Hockey League president, has ordered the Montreal Canadiens to close their rookie training camp on the ground that it violated the league's collective bargaining agreement, which prohibits such camps more than 30 days before the start of a season. In issuing the order Tuesday, just 2 days after the camp opened with 37 invited players, Ziegler said he had acted after receiving inquiries about the camp from several N.H.L. teams. The Canadiens said they operated a similar camp last year, but Ziegler said he had not been aware of it. . . . The New Jersey Devils said they had signed three players to multiyear contracts - the defensemen Mike Kitchen and Murray Brumwell, and the left wing Paul Gagne.

title: Asia Society to Display Japanese Hand-Scrolls
description: Rare examples of the Japanese art of emaki - narrative hand-scrolls- will be on view from Sept. 22 to Nov.6 at the Asia Society, 725 Park Avenue, at 70th Street. Among the examples on display will be two scenes from the 12th-century scroll of the ''Tale of Genji,'' which belongs to Tokyo's Goto Museum.

title: Irish Bank in U.S. Tie
description: Shareholders of First Maryland Bancorp today approved two charter amendments that will enable Allied Irish Banks, Ireland's largest banking company, to purchase a controlling interest in First Maryland. J. Owen Cole, chairman of First Maryland, told shareholders Tuesday that the Allied Irish investment would significantly strengthen the Maryland bank by adding $80 million of additional capital. First Maryland has about $3.8 billion in assets.

Instead of providing a steady beat, he did everything but - he pulled sudden accents out of the air, made quick rushes or shimmers of cymbal sound, extended a soloist's melody phrases or challenged them with cross-rhythms.

FURNITURE FOR THE POST-MODERN INTERIOR
description: IN the 1920's and 30's, the sparsely furnished rooms of modern, functionalist buildings were all the more sparsely furnished because pioneer modernists simply had little modern furniture to choose from. The tubular steel chairs by the architects Marcel Breuer and Mies van der Rohe were not commercially available in the United States until the late 1940's and early 50's. Early modernist architects like R. M. Schindler and Richard Neutra in California had to design their own individual pieces or build appropriate furniture into their houses.

LIBEL AND POLITIC
description: A libel case of extraordinary importance, William C. Westmoreland v. CBS , is now taking shape in pretrial proceedings. The documents already piled up show an extreme example of the lawsuit as a form of combat, between resourceful opponents. But more than that they show a case with troubling implications for American democracy.

title: ALGOREX CORP reports earnings for Year to June 30
Japan, Soviet Set Trade Talk
description: Japan and the Soviet Union have agreed to meet on trade problems, the Foreign Ministry said today.

title: COMPUTER PLOTS EXPECTED STORM COURSE
description: A new procedure designed to help the local authorities decide whether to evacuate coastal residents is getting its first civilian test from Hurricane Alicia.

title: Swiss See Accord on Seized Papers
description: Swiss Government officials said today that they believed agreement could be reached with the United States to secure the release of documents of Marc Rich & Company A.G. that have been subpoenaed in a Federal grand jury investigation of the company.

title: Mayweather Keeps Title
description: Roger Mayweather retained his World Boxing Association junior lightweight title by stopping Benedicto Villablanca of Chile in the first round tonight.

title: Alvin Ailey Benefit
description: Judith Jamison, Louis Falco, George Faison and other dancers formerly with the Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater will appear at a benefit performance for the company on Nov. 30 at 7:30 P.M. at the City Center, 131 West 55th Street.

title: Japanese Talks in U.S.
description: Japanese diplomats and business executives in the United States plan to meet in Washington and New York late this month to discuss trade and defense issues, the Foreign Ministry said.

title: BEVIS INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
TANDYCRAFTS INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-After a loss of $1,818,000 from discontinued operations and an extraordinary gain of $6,100,000.

title: KIMBARK OIL & GAS CO reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
UNIT DRILLING & EXPLORATION CO reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-After a writedown of oil and gas properties totaling $1,800,000. c-Net income. Year-ago net income figures are adjusted to reflect an accounting change.

title: AERO SERVICES INTERNATIONAL INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
Accounts
description: * Legend Pharmacy Co-op, a division of Legend Pharmaceuticals, to Arthur Kramer Advertising.

title: NEW YORKERS LEAVE 'EM LAUGHING OUT WEST
description: It seems cruel. Two New York comedians are booked into the wilderness of Montana and forced to live by their wits, all of their jokes about the neuroses of East Siders and finding an apartment in Manhattan useless to them here.

title: SOUTH TEXAS DRILLING & EXPLORATION reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-After a tax benefit of $133,000. c-Net income after a tax expense of $25,000. Share earnings are fully diluted.

title: PLANNING AIDES IN SOVIET WARY ABOUT ECONOMY
description: Key figures in the Soviet economic hierarchy said at a news conference here today that economic changes set out by Yuri V. Andropov would be applied cautiously and in such a way as to strengthen centralized economic planning.

title: One Less Mill For a Runner
description: Steve Cram wants to compete in the Fifth Avenue Mile on Sept. 3, and the race's sponsors want to have him. Despite that, it appears that the sponsors will have to ''disinvite'' Cram, in order to keep peace with the sport's international governing body.

title: I.B.M. Increases Stake in Intel
description: The International Business Machines Corporation said that it had raised its stake in the Intel Corporation to 13.7 percent, from 12 percent. I.B.M. purchased the additional 1.84 million shares of Intel in open market transactions between the third week of June and the end of July, it said in a recent filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission.

title: COURAGEOUS DEFEATS LIBERTY IN 2 RACES
description: Cutting smoothly through the short chop on Rhode Island Sound, Courageous narrowly defeated Liberty in the two races sailed today in the final trials to select the America's Cup defender.

title: VIKING FREIGHT SYSTEMS INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
Parents' Days
description: Dennis and Ann Price of Enid, Okla., have been excited over the recent exploits of their oldest son, 19- year-old Mark. In March, playing for Georgia Tech, he became the first freshman to lead the Atlantic Coast Conference in basketball scoring.

title: Plan to Save Transturk
description: Four private Turkish banks have agreed to a plan to help save from collapse Transturk Holdings, one of Turkey's biggest industrial groups, banking sources said today.

title: BANKS, BROKERS, THRIFTS
description: What's a bank?

title: City Accuses 2 Of Stealing Checks
description: A community board employee and a former city sanitation worker were charged yesterday with receiving and cashing $15,000 in city checks stolen from a shelter for homeless men, the Department of Investigation said.

title: TV: A SATARIZING OF GOSSIP TABLOIDS
description: ''NATIONAL SNOOP,'' a half-hour NBC-TV comedy, is supposed to satirize gossip tabloids, but actually it's not doing that at all. For one thing, the tabloids are beyond satire. Meanwhile, ''National Snoop'' is not an original idea; it has more lame jokes than clever jokes; it borders on bad taste. On the other hand, it never really crosses the border, and every so often it does something funny. It will be seen on Channel 4 at 9 o'clock tonight.

title: PLUMBING CHINA OIL RESERVE
description: Years of arduous negotiations with China are finally starting to pay off for some of the largest oil companies, yielding contracts to explore and drill in areas off the Chinese coast that may hold the largest untapped reserves in the world.

title: Cleric's Daughter Slain in Trenton
description: The 17- year-old daughter of a local minister was shot to death as she was taking an 8-year-old boy for a walk through a park here, authorities said today.

title: A POLE'S SIGNATURE BETRAYS FREEDOM
description: Ewa Kubasiewicz, a member of Solidarity, is serving a 10-year prison term - one of the longest meted out by the Jaruzelski Government - ''for continuing illegal trade union activity under martial law.'' She is not eligible for release under the amnesty decree put into effect in recent weeks - a dispensation that requires all released prisoners to sign an oath of loyalty to the regime. The following is adapted from a letter she wrote from prison. The full text is reprinted in the fall 1983 issue of ''Survey, A Journal of East & West Studies.''

title: RELIANCE GROUP INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: Reliance Group, Inc. is a unit of Reliance Group Holdings, Inc.

title: London Stocks at Peak
description: The Financial Times 30-share index reached another record high today, closing at 736, up 3.2 from yesterday's record of 732.8. Prices were softer at the opening, but later rose in thin trading, dealers said.

title: Polish Debt Negotiations
description: Talks under way between Western bankers and Polish officials on a rescheduling of Poland's commercial debts may be extended for a third day, a banking source said today. The negotiations, which started Tuesday, were to have ended today. The banks have proposed that 95 percent of the $1.5 billion of commercial debt that is due this year be rescheduled over 10 years, and that 60 percent of $1.1 billion in interest due this year be converted into short-term credits.

title: AND NOW THERE'S EVEN PIZZA POPCORN
description: A scant two years ago, there was plain popcorn and buttered popcorn and caramel popcorn, and a few slightly more exotic flavors such as cinnamon for those who would dare.

title: Lebanon Premier Cuts Work, Vowing to Quit
description: Prime Minister Shafik al-Wazzan threatened to resign and refused to conduct Government business today as a protest over the welcome Christian leaders gave the Israeli Defense Minister in East Beirut Tuesday.

title: BUSINESS PEOPLE
description: The National Securities Clearing Corporation, which clears and settles a major portion of securities trading in the United States, has named David M. Kelly president and director.

title: THE WET LOOK
description: The ocean was starting to get a little crowded. It was nearly 11 o'clock Tuesday morning, and some seven miles out in the Atlantic, on Rhode Island Sound, about two dozen white yachts had gathered, bobbing in the water.

title: Insider Reports
description: The New York and the American stock exchanges issued yesterday their latest reports of changes in the shareholdings of officers, directors and large stockholders in companies whose shares are listed on the exchanges.

title: Squibb in Pact
description: E. R. Squibb & Sons Inc. of Princeton and Connaught Laboratories Ltd. of Toronto, said they had formed a new company, called Squibb-Connaught Inc., to market a full range of biological products and vaccines in the United States. The products will be developed and produced by Connaught and distributed and sold by Squibb through its five regional sales centers. The joint venture will take effect on Jan. 1, officials for the two companies said.

title: One in Six Marketers Offers New Product
description: One in every six marketing exectives is now introducing new products or new product lines, according to a survey by Peterson Blyth Cato Associates, a packaging design and marketing communications concern, of more than 100 senior-level executives from package-goods companies with annual sales of more than $50 million.

title: Liberia Closes Paper
description: The Liberian Government has closed until further notice the country's only independent daily newspaper, The Daily Observer, the Monrovia radio reported today.

title: JEWISH MEMORIAL HOSPITAL SHUTS AFTER 6 SHAKY YEARS
description: Jewish Memorial Hospital announced its closing yesterday and began padlocking its doors at Broadway and 196th Street, in the Inwood section, and sending its patients to other hospitals.

title: Early Sparring
description: Alexis Arg"uello was absent from a news conference to promote his Sept. 9 rematch with Aaron Pryor, But Bill Miller, Arg"uella's agent, accused Pryor of using illegal unpadded gloves in their bout last November in Miami.

title: ABRAMS INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to July 31
SCM CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Includes income from discontinued operations of $1,588,000 for the quarter and $3,943,000 for the year, and a charge of $5,812,000 for the quarter and year from the disposal of discontinued operations. c-After losses from discontinued operations of $1,676,000 for the quarter and $3,374,000 for the year, and charges for plant closings of $1,500,000 for the quarter and $2,400,000 and $4,000,000 for the 6 months.

title: PHH GROUP INC reports earnings for Qtr to July 31
MERCANTILE STORES CO INC reports earnings for Qtr to July 31
description: b-Includes a gain of $916,000, or 6 cents a share, from the sale of land. Share earnings reflect a 2.5-for-1 stock split paid June 15.

title: MUSIC: FOCUS ON 2 MODERN WORKS AT TANGLEWOOD
description: The core of Tanglewood's Festival of Contemporary Music, otherwise known as the Fromm Week, is the series of concerts at the Theater-Concert Hall performed by the student fellows of the Berkshire Music Center. The third of the four such concerts this summer took place Tuesday night, and the focus of attention was two works already established as modern masterpieces - or at least as modern curiosities.

title: WORLDWIDE ENERGY CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: Year-ago results were restated to reflect an accounting change relating to foreign currency translation.

title: 'CUTESY' ANCHORS ARE GOING OUT OF STYLE
description: To the Editor:

title: No Dogfights, No Raids
description: At noon yesterday, with a police helicopter hovering overhead, Gary Esterow of the A.S.P.C.A. stood in a Bronx shopping plaza, off the Bruckner Expressway. He was giving reporters maps of Sound View Park, where an illegal dogfight was supposedly taking place.

title: Reagan Found Gaining On Leading Democrats
description: President Reagan is improving his standing against leading Democrats in ''trial heats'' posed by the Gallup Poll, running about even with former Vice President Walter F. Mondale and barely behind Senator John Glenn of Ohio.

title: GALVESTON ISOLATED BY TIDES
description: A potentially devastating hurricane, still gathering power, reached the coast tonight and endangered heavily populated coastal areas of Texas., Thousands of people had already voluntarily left their homes in low-lying areas.

title: LUNDQUIST BREAKS WORLD SWIM MARK
description: Steve Lundquist said he felt terrible after swimming his qualifying heat this morning, and he did not think he would do well tonight.

title: ENERSERV PRODUCTS INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: Latest results reflect a nonrecurring extraordinary gain of $747,657, or 17 cents a share, for the transfer of oilfield products to a supplier to reduce debt.

title: Klecko, McNeil to Test Knees
description: The two most noted right knees of the Jets, those of Freeman McNeil and Joe Klecko, will be tested in a game for the first time this exhibition season Thursday night.

title: MISSISSIPPI: 20 YEARS OF WIDE RACIAL CHANGE
description: Cora Jones, the receptionist, is the first employee you see when you walk into the Mississippi Governor's office. She is capable and friendly. She is also black.

title: CITY SUBWAYS: FUN TO SOME, A 'VALLEY OF DEATH' TO OTHERS
description: For Ida Friedman, riding the subways is a matter of faith - her faith in the Lord.

title: THRIFT UNIT RESCUED IN L.I. MERGER
description: The Long Island Savings Bank acquired the troubled Suffolk County Federal Savings and Loan Association yesterday. The Federal Savings and Loan Insurance Corporation injected funds into both institutions to make the deal possible.

title: LOMAK PETROLEUM reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
WHAT FIRMS SHOULD DO TO QUALIFY FOR AID
description: To the Editor:

title: ANGELICA CORP reports earnings for Qtr to July 30
Blood-Spattered General Shuns Legal Action
description: A United States general who was spattered with blood by a West German political activist protesting Washington's policy in Central America will not take legal action against the man, an American Army spokesman said today.

title: Advertising; Olympics Almost Sold Out
description: IF you have a spare million, you can still buy a few minutes on the 1984 Olympic Games. ABC has $32 million worth of time, or 2 percent of its 4,859 30-second spots, looking for an advertiser.

title: MEDICARE RATE SET FOR HOSPICE CARE OF TERMINALLY ILL
description: The Department of Health and Human Services, moving to provide a new Medicare benefit for the elderly terminally ill, today set Federal payment rates for hospice care.

title: POLISH UNDERGROUND BACKS CALL FOR SLOWDOWN
description: The underground Solidarity leader of Warsaw has endorsed the call by a secret committee in the Gdansk Shipyard for a nationwide work slowdown unless the authorities meet with Lech Walesa.

title: ATCO LTD reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: Year-ago results have been restated for a change in accounting for gas costs in the gas utility subsidiaries.

title: American Solar
description: The American Solar King Corporation, which is based in Waco, Tex., announced that it had agreed to sell for $30 million in cash its Packerland Packing Company's Solar Utility energy system to the Equilease Corporation, a wholly owned subsidiary of the Allied Corporation. The sale will be recognized in the first half of the fiscal year ended July 1984.

title: BLACK MEDICAL DEAN IN APPEAL FOR FUNDS TO TRAIN PHYSICIANS
description: The head of a black medical school said today that the number of members of minority groups in the health profession was slipping to the vanishing point. He said more funds were needed for schools serving members of minority groups.

title: ENEX RESOURCES reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Net losses.

title: City Communications Gets Goodlife Magazine
description: Goodlife, a national magazine that is aimed at upper-income families and whose two previous publishers went into bankruptcy, has been sold to City Communications of Atlanta.

title: TELEPHONE NEGOTIATORS SAY TALKS ARE MAKING PROGRESS
description: Both sides reported the first real movement today toward ending the nationwide strike against the American Telephone and Telegraph Company. Some officials expressed hope for a settlement by the weekend.

title: STANDARD METALS CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Net loss.

title: Sri Lanka Extends Emergency for a Month
description: Sri Lanka extended its state of emergency for another month today, officials said, to prevent a resurgence of the recent riots that killed 385 people.

title: GENERAL BUILDERS CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Net income which includes extraordinary credits of $29,710 for the quarter and $38,710 for the 6 months.

title: Spaniard Is Booked In Taking of Hostages
description: A despondent, unemployed Spaniard who held four hostages at gunpoint in Spain's consulate and futilely demanded that his family be flown to Puerto Rico was jailed today on kidnapping and extortion charges.

title: MICROSEMICONDUCTOR CORP.  reports earnings for Qtr to July 3
Demers to Coach Blues
description: Jacques Demers , a former coach of the Quebec Nordiques, was named coach of the St. Louis Blues, who agreed to give the Nordiques two players to gain Demers's release from his three-year contract with the Nordique organization. Demers, who coached the Nordiques in their first season in the National Hockey League (1979-80), has coached their top farm club, the Fredericton Express, for the last two seasons. For Demers, the Nordiques are getting Claude Julian , a defenseman who played in Salt Lake City last year, and a player to be chosen from a list submitted by the Blues.

title: ELECTION-RELATED STRIFE IN NIGERIA
description: Demonstrators killed several officials of the governing National Party of Nigeria and set fire to a voting commission office, officials said today.

title: TENSIONS OVER BEAUMONT THEATER ARE INCREASING
description: Two recent developments have intensified the disagreements between the board of directors of Lincoln Center and the board of its constituent, the Beaumont Theater - which has been idle for five out of the last six years.

title: CORRECTION
description: The Sports People column yesterday incorrectly described Ray Grebey's former job in major league baseball. He led the owners' Player Relations Committee.

title: U.S. UPSETS ISRAEL OVER JERUSALEM
description: Israel's Foreign Ministry and Mayor Teddy Kollek of Jerusalem reacted sharply today to a State Department spokesman's remark Tuesday that the United States had never recognized the Israeli annexation of East Jerusalem.

title: 'CUTESY' ANCHORS ARE GOING OUT OF STYLE
description: To the Editor:

description: Words and Music

title: EIGHT BUILDINGS TO BE CONVERTED TO HOUSE POOR AND ELDERLY
description: Eight buildings, including a former convent and two Roman Catholic schools, will be converted into housing for the poor and elderly in a program announced yesterday at City Hall.

title: TWIN CITY BARGE & TOWING CO reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Net income.

title: Grumman-Egypt
description: The Grumman Corporation said the Government of Egypt had signed letters of acceptance to purchase for $465 million two E-2C Hawkeye Airborne Early Warning System aircraft.

title: HOME BEAT
description: HE used to paint furniture when he was a child. That's one way to explain the inspiration for Alexander Polakov's recent furniture designs.

title: TOWER ZONING LEADS TO BITTER COURT FIGHT
description: In 1981, New York City reached a novel agreement with two developers who wanted to build an office tower on Third Avenue between 52d and 53d Streets.

title: UNITRODE CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: Results are adjusted for a 2-for-1 stock split paid in July 1983.

title: Caracas View On Oil Quota
description: Venezuela will argue for restraint when OPEC's market monitoring committee meets on Sept. 13 in Vienna to review production quotas, senior officials of the Ministry of Energy and Mines said today.

title: WILSHIRE OIL CO OF TEXAS reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Includes income of $1,420,000 from discontinued operations. c-Includes income from discontinued operations of $2,077,000 for the quarter and $3,470,000 for the 6 months.

title: SONGS EMBODIED BROADWAY
description: Ira Gershwin, the lyricist who collaborated with his brother, George, on the scores for Broadway musicals that included ''Porgy and Bess'' and ''Of Thee I Sing,'' died yesterday at his home in Beverly Hills, Calif. He was 86 years old.

title: Lucas Accord With Car Maker
description: Lucas Industries P.L.C. will soon complete a licensing agreement with a major United States automotive company to use a Lucas process that enables the use of lighter steels in vehicle components, a Lucas spokesman said.

title: Brewers, on Sweep, Take First Place
description: Tom Candiotti, a rookie called up from the minors earlier this month, pitched a seven-hitter for his first major league victory to help the Milwaukee Brewers to a 5-1 victory over the Boston Red Sox and a sweep of a twilight-night doubleheader.

title: ARGENTINA GETS U.S. A-PLANT AID
description: The Reagan Administration has approved the sale of 143 metric tons of ''heavy water'' to Argentina for use in its nuclear reactors.

description: b-Net losses.

description: TO THE HOME SECTION:

title: AMERICAN PACIFIC INTERNATIONAL INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
CORRECTION
description: Because of a transmission error, the text of a cover letter yesterday from Allan A. Ryan Jr. of the Justice Department to the Attorney General about Klaus Barbie was incorrect. The text should have read: ''They were acting within the scope of their official duties. Their actions were taken not for personal gain, or to shield them personally from liability or discipline, but to protect what they believed to be the interests of the United States Army and the United States Government.''

title: 60 Pages of Ads Sold For Olympics Program
description: The Olympic Games are a multimedia event, although print has a more modest share. Sports Illustrated, which is producing and distributing the official souvenir program for the Los Angeles games, has already sold more than 60 pages at almost $2 million to advertisers, including a number of Olympic sponsors.

title: FERROFLUIDICS CORP reports earnings for Year to June 30
description: b-Net loss.

title: Peters Enters Plea
description: Tony Peters , the Washington Redskins' star safety, pleaded not guilty yesterday to a nine-count indictment accusing him of serving as the middleman in a conspiracy to distribute cocaine. At the arraignment in Federal court in Alexandria, Va., Judge Richard L. Williams set Oct. 12 as the date for the trial of Peters and three co-defendants, who also pleaded not guilty.

title: CENTRONICS DATA COMPUTER CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Including extraordinary gains of $57,000 for the quarter and $153,000 for the 6 months. c-Net losses.

title: INTEREST RATES DROP SHARPLY
description: Interest rates declined in all sectors of the credit market yesterday, as good investor demand led to price gains of a point or more for many Treasury, corporate and tax-exempt bonds.

title: Olivetti Head to Resign
description: The president of Ing. C. Olivetti & Company, Bruno Visentini, who was recently nominated as Finance Minister of Italy's new Government, said today that he would resign from Olivetti on Aug. 29. He will be replaced by the current vice president and managing director, Carlo de Benedetti, company sources said.

title: FEDERATED DEPARTMENT STORES INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
2 Men Wounded On Henry Street
description: Two men were seriously wounded by pistol shots fired by a third man yesterday in an apartment shared by the three at 123 Henry Street on the Lower East Side, the police said.

title: CIRCLE K CORP reports earnings for Qtr to July 31
EASTERN AIR LINES SEES WIDER DEFICIT
description: Eastern Air Lines Inc. announced yesterday that it estimated it had lost $12 million in July compared with a deficit of $7 million in the same month last year.

title: ORROX CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
Grain Accord Signing Is Set
description: The United States and the Soviet Union plan to sign a new five-year grain agreement on Aug. 25 in Moscow, American officials said today.

title: Shame, Pride and Klaus Barbie
description: How rare it is for a proud and powerful nation to admit shabby behavior. That's just what the United States has done in the Klaus Barbie case. Shameful as the episode was, the admission of blame the United States made Tuesday, first to itself and then to France, goes far to redeem national honor.

title: Technology; Robots' Future Taking Shape
description: A CONSENSUS is forming on how to build a better robot. Many experts say future factory applications should not be designed for physical strength or the ability to turn easily from making toasters to making automobiles.

title: VIRCO MANUFACTURING CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
EARL AVERILL, 81, A HALL OF FAMER
description: Earl Averill, a Hall of Fame outfielder often remembered as the batter whose line drive helped end the pitching career of Dizzy Dean, died Tuesday night in Providence Hospital, where he had been since July 11 suffering from pneumonia. He was 81 years old.

title: THE MAN BEHIND MARC RICH
description: It is the classic immigrant success story. Speaking only a foreign tongue, a young man flees war-torn Europe for America where, after an apprenticeship in a business run by other immigrants, he starts his own firm and becomes a multimillionaire.

title: Coleco Delays Adam Delivery
description: - Coleco Industries, which planned to start deliveries of its new Adam home computer by Aug. 31, said that the initial shipments would be ''a couple of days late.'' But Coleco played down the delay as insignificant.

description: TO THE HOME SECTION:

title: BRIEFS
description: Debt Issues

NAVY TRACKING SOVIET VESSEL
description: A Soviet cargo ship believed to be carrying arms for Nicaragua is being tracked by the United States Navy through the Caribbean, Pentagon sources said today.

title: WAR-SCATTERED KOREAN KIN FIND THEIR KIN AT LAST
description: With a look of expectant anguish, Koo Yang Ae pressed a small handkerchief to the side of her face, her hand trembling slightly.

title: CORADIAN CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
CINDY'S INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Including tax credits of $40,000 for the quarter and $80,000 for the 6 months. c-Net loss.

title: ITEL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
Market Place; Analysts Differ Over Outlook
description: EVER since the Dow Jones industrial average closed at a record 1,248.30 on June 16 and then began to slump, many market analysts have kept a watchful eye on 1,180. That figure was regarded as providing ''support'' for the average, inasmuch as it had rebuffed every downturn since mid-April.

title: Dr. Bard Cosman Dead at 52; Teacher and Plastic Surgeon
description: Dr. Bard Cosman, an attending plastic surgeon at Presbyterian Hospital of the Columbia-Presbyterian Medical Center, died of malignant lymphoma Sunday at his home in Tenafly, N.J. He was 52 years old.

title: Oil Stockpile Contractor
description: The Government will likely restore soon a line of credit to the contractor that manages its Strategic Petroleum Reserve, Energy Department officials said today.

title: MRS. HECKLER ASKS MORE AIDS FUNDS
description: Margaret M. Heckler, the Secretary of Health and Human Services, said in New York yesterday that she would press Congress next year to approve $40 million for research on acquired immune deficiency syndrome, doubling the Federal financial research commitment.

title: ARISTEK COMMUNITIES reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
WILSON BROTHERS reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-After an extraordinary charge of $141,000 for the quarter and an extraordinary credit of $121,000 for the 6 months. c-Net loss. The company said its share earnings for the latest 6 months include common stock equivalents for convertible notes issued in connection with Wilson Bros.' previously reported amendment to its credit agreement.

title: MILLER-WOHL CO reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: Share earnings reflect a 2-for-1 stock split paid August 10.

title: JAZZ PIANO: TANIA MARIA PLAYS, SINGS
description: VERY few jazz pianists can sustain the kind of driving rhythmic dynamism of Tania Maria, the popular Brazilian-born keyboardist and scat singer who opened a six-night engagement at the Village Gate Tuesday. Though Miss Maria also has a more sedate, lyrical side to her personality, her signature style is excitedly percussive, as she develops and embellishes original Latin-flavored melodies into fiery displays of technique.

title: BRIEFS
description: * Arco Chemical Co., Philadelphia, said it would no longer sell methanol directly to companies that blend the product with gasoline and, instead, would sell only blends of methanol and gasoline grade tertiary butyl alcohol. The action is being taken in response to concerns voiced by automotive companies including Chrysler, which have said the high levels of methanol could cause motor damage.

title: China Considers Joining World Nuclear Agency
description: China said today that it was considering applying soon to join the International Atomic Energy Agency, after a visit to Peking by the agency's Director General, Hans Blix.

title: Rozelle Disputes Figure
description: Pete Rozelle , the the National Football League commissioner, said that ''way below 20 percent'' of the league's players were drug users, not 50 percent, as a recent newspaper article said. In The Daily News article on Sunday, Rozelle was quoted as having said, when asked about the 50 percent figure, ''You've done your research well.'' Yesterday, however, he said he had been quoted out of context and had not confirmed the figure. ''I think it's way below 50 percent, way below 20 percent, on the basis of our security reports,'' he said.

title: Federated Net Soars
description: Federated Department Stores Inc. said yesterday that second-quarter earnings nearly doubled, while sales increased 16 percent.

title: INDEPENDANCE OF CLARENDON AT CENTER OF INQUIRY
description: A key issue in the investigations surrounding Marc Rich & Company A.G., one of the world's largest commodity traders, has been the independence of a company that at one time was a subsidiary operating in the United States.

title: ANDROPOV PROMISES FLEXIBILITY AT ARMS TALKS
description: Yuri V. Andropov said today that the Soviet Union would follow a ''constructive and flexible line'' when talks on intermediate- range nuclear missiles resume in Geneva next month, in the hope of encouraging a compromise with the United States.

title: 8 Billion Offer of Notes
description: The Treasury yesterday announced plans to sell $8 billion of new two-year notes next Wednesday. Proceeds will be used to refund $4.8 billion of maturing two-year notes and to raise $3.2 billion of new cash.

title: I.C.C. FAVORS RAIL-TRUCK MERGER
description: The Interstate Commerce Commission, in another move to deregulate ground transportation, proposed today to allow railroads complete freedom to acquire trucking companies so long as the acquisitions are not anticompetitive.

title: CARSON PIRIE SCOTT & CO reports earnings for Qtr to July 30
Docutel Names Head After 3-Month Search
description: The Docutel/Olivetti Corporation, maker of automated teller machines and United States marketer of Olivetti products, said yesterday that it had named John J. Douglas as president and chief operating officer.

title: CALENDAR OF EVENTS: BROOKLYN FESTIVAL
description: Crafts Fair and Block Festival, St. Mark's Avenue between Flatbush and Carlton Avenues, Brooklyn, 212-636-7807. Saturday from noon to 6 P.M. the fair will be in session. It will feature the work of artisans from Prospect Heights and surrounding neighborhoods. Pottery, woven goods and jewelry are among the items that will be on display.

title: Rambling Willie Wins 127th Pace
description: Rambling Willie, the top- winning horse in harness racing history, scored his 127th victory tonight when he triumphed in the $20,000 feature pace at the Meadowlands.

title: Jeep XJ Prices To Start at $9,995
description: The American Motors Corporation announced that prices on its new Jeep XJ models, the first completely new Jeep vehicles in 20 years, would start at $9,995.

title: COMPTEK RESEARCH reports earnings for Qtr to July 1
HCC INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to July 2
description: Results include operations of Glasseal-Products Inc. and Sealtron since the date of acquisition, June 14.

title: Sweet Sound of A.C.
description: TO THE HOME EDITOR:

title: EX-PROSECUTOR CHARGED WITH MOLESTING GIRL, 10
description: Eugene Gold, who was Brooklyn's District Attorney for 12 years, was charged yesterday with a sexual offense involving the 10-year-old daughter of a prosecutor in Nashville. Mr. Gold, who was in Nashville to address a convention of the National District Attorneys Association, denied the charge and was freed on $50,000 bail.

title: FIRST CAPITAL FINANCIAL reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
Quake in Philippines Kills 7; More Than 100 Reported Hurt
description: A strong earthquake rocked President Ferdinand E. Marcos's home province in the northern Philippines for 20 seconds tonight, killing at least seven people and toppling and damaging buildings, the Government said.

title: MUSIC: SCHUB AT FESTIVAL
description: THE performances by the Cleveland Quartet at the Mostly Mozart Festival in Avery Fisher Hall on Tuesday night occupied that peculiar region of musical experience in which everything is quite correct, sensitive, proper and energetic, but in which the results are less than engrossing or captivating. Only when the quartet was joined by its guest soloists - the pianist Andre-Michel Schub and the flutist Ransom Wilson - did the music become involving as well as refined.

title: Supply System Files Suit
description: A damage suit has been filed against six major electrical contractors who already face criminal bid-rigging charges on nuclear power projects in the state of Washington and Indiana, a lawyer said today.

title: OFFSHORE LOGISTICS INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
U.S. HEALTH CARE - PRIVATE, PUBLIC AND NONE
description: To the Editor:

title: EXCELSIOR INSURANCE CO reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Operating loss. c-Net loss.

title: AMDISCO CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-After a loss of $12,000 for the quarter and income of $9,000 for the 9 months from discontinued operations. c-Including income from discontinued operations of $133,000 for the quarter and $205,000 for the 9 months.

title: Washington Navy Yard Feels Bomb Blast in Computer Area
description: An explosion rocked a computer operations center at the Washington Navy Yard early today minutes after military officials were warned that a bombing would occur, the Navy said.

title: MGF OIL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
ZYMOS CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
SEA CONTAINERS GROUP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-After a foreign exchange loss of $1,296,000 for the quarter and a foreign exchange gain of $607,000 for the 6 months. c-After foreign exchange gains of $1,367,000 for the quarter and $2,535,000 for the 6 months.

title: Youngest McEnroe Tries Calmer Way
description: At Wimbledon, where the junior competitors get scant attention except from their parents and the most sophisticated of tennis fans, the loser of the boys' semifinal was invited to the interview room earlier this summer. While Stefan Edberg, who won the match and ultimately the junior title, was taking a shower in peace, his opponent faced a roomful of reporters and fielded their sometimes needling questions with aplomb.

title: WILLIAMS,T E, PHARMACEUTICALS INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
Prices of Treasury Bonds Fall
description: Prices of long-term Treasury bonds, after soaring as much as five points in the past week, declined about three-fourths of a point yesterday. Market participants cited weaker investor demand, and said there were no significant developments pointing to changes in interest rates.

title: Berry Decision Expected
description: The college eligibility of Walter Berry, who for the last year has hoped to play basketball for St. John's University, was voted upon in a secret ballot this afternoon by a National Collegiate Athletic Association panel. No official decision on the status of the former high school all-American will be announced until Friday.

title: Hearst Picks A Publisher
description: Charles J. Kennedy, whose resignation as publisher of Newsweek ''to try to run something himself'' was announced earlier this month, has been appointed publisher of Town & Country. Mr. Kennedy, 48 years old, succeeds David A. McCann, 54, who has been named publisher of Connoisseur magazine, another Hearst publication. Both appointments are effective Sept. 5.

title: FAST FOOD OPERATIONS reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
DANCERS' CHOICE: ROOFTOP OR BEACH
description: DANCE need not take place on a proscenium stage. It can spill out into gymnasiums and the streets if necessary. That was one of the innovations of Merce Cunningham and the modern-dance experimentalists of the 1960's. This weekend, innovation will reach new levels, as dance takes to the beach and a church rooftop at opposite ends of Manhattan.

title: VICTOR TECHNOLOGIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-After a tax charge of $357,000 for the quarter and a tax credit of $216,000 for the 6 months.

title: CORRECTION
description: An article on yesterday's Washington Talk page incorrectly described the position of Nora Engel in the office of Rep. Bruce A. Morrison, Democrat of Connecticut. She is a case worker and former campaign manager.

title: COEUR D'ALENE MINES CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
Citicorp Notes
description: A $150 million issue of Citicorp 12 1/4 percent notes, due in 1993, was offered at a price of 100 through underwriters led by Goldman, Sachs & Company. The notes, rated Aa-1, are not callable for five years and are then callable at a price of 100. The notes were part of a shelf registration that Citicorp had filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission.

title: MORGAN KEEGAN & CO INC reports earnings for Qtr to July 31
VERIT INDUSTRIES reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Includes a gain of $39,715, or 5 cents a share, res ulting from the difference between insurance proceeds at replacement costs and depreciated book value of assets destroyed in a fire at the company's meat-processing facility.

title: ACME ELECTRIC CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Net income. c-After a nonrecurring expense of $258,000 for the settlement of litigation.

title: PIANISTS WHO MAKE MUSIC WITH A NEW VOCABULARY
description: ''PEOPLE think that music is a very difficult subject,'' the pianist Joanne Brackeen said the other day. ''Well, I think technical stuff is boring. When students come to me, I say: 'Look at the piano. It's just black and white keys there - the tones go higher to the right and lower to the left. You just connect that with your fingers.' ''

title: SHOREHAM OPENING DELAYED FOR AT LEAST 3 MORE MONTHS
description: The Long Island Lighting Company announced yesterday that completion of its Shoreham nuclear plant would be delayed at least three to five months because of problems with an emergency diesel generator. The delay will raise the cost by $105 million to $175 million.

title: CORRECTION
description: Because of an editing error, the article ''A Pole's Signature Betrays Freedom,'' published yesterday, was incorrectly attributed to Ewa Kubasiewicz. It was written by Adam Michnik under the pseudonym Andrzej Zagozda. Ewa Kubasiewicz's 10- year sentence reportedly has been commuted to three years and she may no longer be in Bialoleka prison.

title: ISOMEDIX INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Including income of $378,747 from the cumulative effect of a change in accounting.

title: Texas Housing Bonds To Yield Up to 10 1/2%
description: An issue of single-family mortgage revenue bonds of the Texas Housing Finance Agency was increased to $238 million from $150 million yesterday and was tentatively priced with a maximum yield of 10 1/2 percent for bonds due in 2011.

title: BALLET: KOZLOVS' TROUPE
description: Metropolitan-area audiences got a chance tonight, at the Garden State Arts Center, to see a preview of a touring program put together by Leonid and Valentina Kozlov, former Bolshoi Ballet dancers now with the New York City Ballet, before the group sets out on a national tour this fall. It was an evening of mixed pleasures.

title: U.S. Asks Swiss For Aid in Inquiry
description: The United States Government has again asked the Swiss authorities for help in investigating possible insider stock trading violations involving the Santa Fe International Corporation, the Swiss Justice Department has confirmed. An earlier request was blocked by Swiss courts in January with the judgment that the Swiss could not help because insider trading is not illegal in Switzerland.

title: CHICAGO MAYOR TO LAY OFF 1,700, INCLUDING POLICE AND FIREMEN, ; IN COUNcil DISPUTE
description: Mayor Harold Washington said today that layoff notices would go out beginning next week to 1,700 city employees, possibly including more than 500 police officers and 300 firefighters, to help balance the budget.

title: MOZART-STYLE 'MESSIAH' AT TULLY HALL
description: In Mozart's last years, when he had already completed his greatest symphonies and was working on such operas as ''Don Giovanni'' and ''Cos i Fan Tutte,'' the composer also arranged a series of works by Handel. In 1788, he completed ''Acis and Galatea''; in 1790, he arranged ''Alexander's Feast'' and ''Ode for St. Cecilia's Day.'' And in 1789, he had completed a version of ''Messiah.''

title: A SORORITY SETS NEW GOALS
description: Seventy years ago a group of 22 black women at Howard University in Washington pledged themselves to a program of community service and political action, shunning the socially oriented programs of existing sororities. This week members of that group, Delta Sigma Theta Sorority Inc., one of largest organizations of black women in the United States, met here and again pledged themselves to their founding principles.

title: Greenwich Fights Detoured Trucks
description: The town's Health Board says the Mianus River bridge collapse has created a health hazard, and it wants truck traffic reduced on local streets.

title: Transactions
description: BASKETBALL

title: MUSIC: ADVENTURES AND WRITINGS OF JAN DUSSEK
description: THERE are composers whose lives are more fascinating than their music. One very striking example of this was presented in Avery Fisher Hall on Wednesday night, when the Mostly Mozart Festival took an amiable detour from standard fare.

title: Four Killed as Police Fire On Pakistani Crowd
description: Four people were killed and 17 wounded when policemen fired into a crowd in a town in Sind Province today, police sources said.

title: WHAT'S NOT HAPPPENING
description: It's nice to know that Ronald Reagan finally gets the point that even hard-line groups like the Veterans of Foreign Wars don't really want nuclear war. But the real story of his arms control efforts may lie in what he's not doing - as pointed up in Moscow by Yuri Andropov's remarks to a group of visiting senators.

title: Busy Musical Convention
description: In a cross-country gathering of talent, the National Association of Negro Musicians assembled 500 of its 1,500 members at the New York Hilton Hotel this week for its 64th annual convention. It also made music at three Harlem churches, created its own chorus led by John Motley and left time for visits to ''Dreamgirls'' and other local attractions.

title: Hurricane Specialist
description: Robert F. Shea may be the only person who regrets not being in Houston during Hurricane Alicia.

title: Lloyd Named Coach
description: Dan Lloyd , a former linebacker for the Giants, who made a brief comeback in pro football after winning a battle with cancer, has been named an assistant coach at William Paterson College in Wayne, N.J. Appropriately, Lloyd, who joined the Washington Federals last January and later the Michigan Panthers of the United States Football League, will coach linebackers at the Division III school.

title: FLOATING POINT SYSTEMS INC reports earnings for Qtr to July 31
Key Rates
description: Salomon Brothers estimates for bellwether issues

title: PANSOPHIC SYSTEMS INC reports earnings for Qtr to July 31
ANALYSTS INTERNATIONAL reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Including tax credits of $377,000 for the quarter and $602,000 for the year. c-Net income.

title: INQUIRY ON PROGRAM LED BY EX-LEGISLATOR GIVEN TO PROSECUTORS
description: The State Commission of Investigation said yesterday that it had turned over to state and Federal prosecutors evidence of possible frauds totaling $450,000 in state money at a Brooklyn community rehabilitation program.

title: Economic Scene; Transforming U.S. Business
description: AMERICAN business is engaged in a major organizational transformation. This transformation is an effort to accommodate the instability and uncertainty that has marked the economic environment of the last 10 years.

title: HELM RESOURCES (CO) (A) reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Including an extraordinary gains of $370,000 for the quarter and 6 months on the early extinguishment of debt. c-Net income.

title: Monmouth Gets Strong Field of 10
description: Bates Motel, Island Whirl and Deputy Minister, the three top handicap horses in the country, will each carry 124 pounds in a field of 10 that was entered yesterday for the $250,000 Monmouth Handicap Saturday at Monmouth Park.

title: AMERICAN REALTY TRUST reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Including a tax credit of $1,513,000.

title: COCAINE IN COLOMBIA: DAD-DAUGHTER SLEUTHS
description: ''THE COCAINE CARTEL,'' an ''ABC Closeup'' documentary, saves its most fascinating material for the end. Carlos Lehder, who is wanted by United States authorities for his part in the drug traffic, is addressing a political rally in Colombia, denouncing his country's extradition treaty with the United States as a trick. A moment later, in an interview, he says that in resisting extradition he is ''fighting for the rights of my people.'' It is an interesting commentary on politics and international crime. The documentary will be seen tomorrow night at 10 on Channel 7.

title: Wedding on a Hillside
description: He was a Parks Department ranger when he discovered it and now, as the department's information director, Adrian Benepe still has his favorite spot in Central Park - ''a little hillside very dear to me, midpark about 103d Street, with great old elms and maples and a brook at the bottom with white birches.''

title: Tepee Offer
description: Last season, after the tepee of the team mascot was removed on orders of the club owner, Ted Turner, the Atlanta Braves went into their worst slump of the season and Chief Noc- a-Homa's outfield dwelling was restored. When Turner ordered the tepee dismantled again last week to make room for 250 seats, doomsayers predicted dire happenings.

title: OMNI EXPLORATION INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Net income. The company went public in November 1981. Hence, the results for the comparable year-ago periods were for November 7, 1981, to June 30, 1982.

title: 2 OKALHOMA LAWMAKERS GUILTY OF VOTE FRAUD
description: Two leaders of the Oklahoma House of Representatives were convicted today by a Federal jury on vote fraud charges stemming from an unsuccessful scheme to get the father of one of them elected to a state legislative post.

title: LEHIGH VALLEY INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to July 2
description: b-After losses from discontinued operations of $27,000 for the quarter and $59,000 for the 6 months, and an extraordinary gain of $150,000 for the quarter and 6 months. c-Net loss. d-After losses from discontinued operations of $108,000 for the quarter and $527,000 for the 6 months, a loss of $12,682,000 for the quarter and 6 months on the disposal of discontinued operations and and extraordinary gain of $9,705,000 for the quarter and 6 months on the forgiveness of debt.

title: Weinberger Says Koch Issued False Transcript
description: Secretary of Defense Caspar W. Weinberger issued a statement today criticizing Mayor Koch for making public what Mr. Weinberger called ''a very crude attempt at disinformation.''

title: Control Data
description: The Control Data Corporation said it would invest capital, equipment and technologies in a new company, ETA Systems Inc., that will design, manufacture and market so-called super computers. It said ETA would iinitially develop a computer that will be able to perform 10 billion calculations a second for delivery by the end of 1986. Control Data said it expects to hold up to a 40 percent share in the venture.

title: TWIN SALUTE: THE ONION AND POLISH FOLKWAYS
description: Residents of Orange County's black-dirt region will take to the uplands overlooking the low-lying fields tomorrow and Sunday in a twin celebration of Polish folk customs and of the onion, the region's principal crop.

title: COMMODORE CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Including income from discontinued operaions of $57,000. c-After a loss of $106,000 from discontinued operations.

title: VALSPAR CORP reports earnings for Qtr to July 31
AEICOR INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Including income of $6,000 for the quarter and a loss of $217,000 for the 6 months from discontinued operations. c-Net income including extraordinary credits of $84,000 for the quarter and $110,000 for the 6 months.

title: Hydro Lets Bonds Run for 15 Years
description: A $250 million issue of British Columbia Hydro and Power Authority bonds due in 2013 was offered at a price of 98.654 to yield 12.675 percent through underwriters led by the First Boston Corporation.

title: E.R. WEIDLEIN, EX-DIRECTOR OF MELLON RESEARCH INSTITUTE
description: Edward R. Weidlein, a chemical engineer and former president and chairman of the Mellon Institute, died late Monday night at his home in Rector, Pa. He was 96 years old.

A New Yorker Makes Good
description: A New Yorker Makes Good

title: Integration Plans Atevised
description: Education Commissioner Saul Cooperman said today that he would allow the Union County community of Hillside to desegregate its elementary schools in two phases rather than enforce an unpopular plan designed to achieve full racial balance when classes resume next month.

title: AT THE MOVIES
description: GUNTER LAMPRECHT, who plays Franz Biberkopf in ''Berlin Alexanderplatz'' (at the Lincoln Plaza 2), was himself born on Alexanderplatz in 1930.

title: Phillies 4, Padres 2
description: Bo Diaz hit a two-run homer in the 10th inning to help Philadelphia snap San Diego's four-game winning streak.

title: Comeback for Geyser
description: The Delacorte Geyser, which spouts treated East River water into the air on Roosevelt Island, will be operating again this weekend - maybe.

title: Security Tightened by Navy After Computer Center Blast
description: Navy officials increased security at the Washington Navy Yard today as investigators searched for clues to some type of blast just after midnight in a computer center.

title: DR. JOHN SOKOL
description: Dr. John Sokol, education and program specialist of the Federal Department of Education, died last Saturday in Falmouth (Mass.) Hospital as a result of injuries suffered in an automobile accident in Falmouth.

title: REHABILITATION HOSPITAL SERVICES reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
S.E.C. Settles Insider Case
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission announced today that it had settled a case charging a former consultant to the Braniff International Corporation and a stockbroker with Prudential- Bache Securities with trading on the basis of illegal insider information about Braniff the day before the company filed for bankruptcy.

title: CFS CONTINENTAL INC reports earnings for Qtr to July 9
description: b-Including income of $249,000 from equity in the net income of affiliate and a net gain on the sale of affiliate.

title: U.S. PRESSES FOR INCREASED RELIEF AID FOR FAMINE-STRICKEN ETHIOPIA
description: The Reagan Administration has decided to press for increased relief assistance for Ethiopia, where drought and famine now threaten hundreds of thousands, according to officials of the Agency for International Development.

title: TANDY CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
AMERICAN STATES LEASING CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Including a nonrecurring gain of $32,500 for the quarter and 9 months.
